intro: Leucadendron heterophyllum, commonly known as the silver leaf leucadendron, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its striking, cone-shaped inflorescences that range in color from yellow to red. The plant features narrow, silver-gray leaves that give it its common name and help reduce water loss in its natural habitat. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for coastal and Mediterranean climates. Leucadendron heterophyllum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
